SEARCH
Package com.carlos

Class FizzBuzzTest

java.lang.Object
com.carlos.FizzBuzzTest
public class FizzBuzzTest extends Object
Unit test suite for the FizzBuzz class.

These tests follow the TDD approach: tests are written first, and the implementation is added afterwards.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FizzBuzzTest()
    Default constructor for the test class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    canInstantiateFizzBuzz()
    Verifies that the FizzBuzz class can be instantiated.
    void
    computeAnyFizzBuzzNumbers()
    Verifies compute() behavior for composite cases where both "Fizz" and "Buzz" might appear according to the kata's specific rules.
    void
    computeBuzzNumbers()
    Verifies compute() returns "Buzz" for numbers that contain 5 or are divisible by 5 but are not divisible by 3 or contain 3 (according to the kata rules implemented).
    void
    computeFizzNumbers()
    Verifies compute() returns "Fizz" for numbers that contain 3 or are divisible by 3 but are not divisible by 5 or contain 5 (according to the kata rules implemented).
    void
    computeNormalNumbers()
    Verifies the compute() method returns the number as a string for inputs that are not positive or zero.
    void
    computeThrowsOnInvalidNumber()
    Verifies compute() returns IllegalArgumentException for invalid inputs.
    void
    constructorThrowsOnInvalidLimit()
    Verifies the constructor throws an exception for invalid limits.
    void
    playFizzBuzzUpToLimitToList()
    Verifies playToList() returns the full FizzBuzz sequence up to the configured limit and that its elements match the expected sequence computed by calling FizzBuzz.compute(int) repeatedly.
    void
    playFizzBuzzUpToLimitToText()
    Verifies playToText() returns a newline-separated representation of the full FizzBuzz sequence equivalent to joining the list returned by playFizzBuzzUpToLimitToList().
    static void
    setUp()
    Initializes shared state once before all tests in this class.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • FizzBuzzTest

      public FizzBuzzTest()
      Default constructor for the test class.

      This constructor is explicit so the Javadoc tool does not emit a warning about the implicit default constructor.

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeAll public static void setUp()
      Initializes shared state once before all tests in this class.

      Using @BeforeAll reduces setup overhead by creating a single instance reused across tests. The setup method must be static.

    • canInstantiateFizzBuzz

      @Test public void canInstantiateFizzBuzz()
      Verifies that the FizzBuzz class can be instantiated.

      This test is the simplest case of the kata: the class should construct without throwing and must not be null.

    • constructorThrowsOnInvalidLimit

      @Test public void constructorThrowsOnInvalidLimit()
      Verifies the constructor throws an exception for invalid limits.

    • computeNormalNumbers

      @Test public void computeNormalNumbers()
      Verifies the compute() method returns the number as a string for inputs that are not positive or zero.

    • computeFizzNumbers

      @Test public void computeFizzNumbers()
      Verifies compute() returns "Fizz" for numbers that contain 3 or are divisible by 3 but are not divisible by 5 or contain 5 (according to the kata rules implemented).

    • computeBuzzNumbers

      @Test public void computeBuzzNumbers()
      Verifies compute() returns "Buzz" for numbers that contain 5 or are divisible by 5 but are not divisible by 3 or contain 3 (according to the kata rules implemented).

    • computeAnyFizzBuzzNumbers

      @Test public void computeAnyFizzBuzzNumbers()
      Verifies compute() behavior for composite cases where both "Fizz" and "Buzz" might appear according to the kata's specific rules.

    • computeThrowsOnInvalidNumber

      @Test public void computeThrowsOnInvalidNumber()
      Verifies compute() returns IllegalArgumentException for invalid inputs.

    • playFizzBuzzUpToLimitToList

      @Test public void playFizzBuzzUpToLimitToList()
      Verifies playToList() returns the full FizzBuzz sequence up to the configured limit and that its elements match the expected sequence computed by calling FizzBuzz.compute(int) repeatedly.

    • playFizzBuzzUpToLimitToText

      @Test public void playFizzBuzzUpToLimitToText()
      Verifies playToText() returns a newline-separated representation of the full FizzBuzz sequence equivalent to joining the list returned by playFizzBuzzUpToLimitToList().
